messages.cyclomaticComplexity: The cyclomatic complexity {{totalComplexity}} exceeds the defined limit {{maxComplexity}}

cyclomatic-complexity.description: Checks cyclomatic complexity against a specified limit. It is a quantitative measure of the number of linearly independent paths through a program's source code

messages.noInlineStyles: <{{element}}/> element should not have inline styles via style attribute. Please use classes instead.

no-inline-styles.description: Disallows the use of inline styles in HTML templates

no-call-expression.description: Disallows calling expressions in templates, except for output handlers

messages.noPositiveTabindex: The `tabindex` attribute should not be positive

no-positive-tabindex.description: Ensures that the `tabindex` attribute is not positive

messages.useTrackByFunction: Missing trackBy function in ngFor directive

messages.accessibilityAltText: <{{element}}/> element must have a text alternative.

accessibility-alt-text.description: Enforces alternate text for elements which require the alt, aria-label, aria-labelledby attributes.

messages.noNegatedAsync: Async pipe results should not be negated. Use `(observable | async) === false`, `(observable | async) === null`, or `(observable | async) === undefined` to check its value instead

no-negated-async.description: Ensures that async pipe results are not negated

eqeqeq.description: Requires `===` and `!==` in place of `==` and `!=`

allowTwoWayDataBinding.description: Whether or not two-way data binding is allowed as an exception to the rule.

ignore.description: Input or output properties for which duplicate presence is allowed as an exception to the rule.

no-duplicate-attributes.description: Ensures that there are no duplicate input properties or output event listeners

accessibility-elements-content.description: Ensures that the heading, anchor and button elements have content in it

messages.conditionalComplexity: The conditional complexity {{totalComplexity}} exceeds the defined limit {{maxComplexity}}

conditional-complexity.description: The conditional complexity should not exceed a rational limit

messages.attributesOrder: The element's attributes/bindings did not match the expected order: expected {{expected}} instead of {{actual}}

attributes-order.description: Ensures that HTML attributes and Angular bindings are sorted based on an expected order

messages.i18nAttribute: Attribute "{{attributeName}}" has no corresponding i18n attribute. See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n#mark-element-attributes-for-translations
messages.i18nAttributeOnIcuOrText: Each element containing text node should have an i18n attribute. See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n#mark-plurals-and-alternates-for-translation and https://angular.io/guide/i18n#mark-text-for-translations
messages.i18nCustomIdOnAttribute: Missing custom ID on attribute "i18n-{{attributeName}}". See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n#manage-marked-text-with-custom-ids
messages.i18nCustomIdOnElement: Missing custom ID on element. See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n#manage-marked-text-with-custom-ids
messages.i18nDuplicateCustomId: Duplicate custom ID "@@{{customId}}". See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n#define-unique-custom-ids
messages.i18nMissingDescription: Missing i18n description on element. See more at https://angular.io/guide/i18n-common-prepare#i18n-metadata-for-translation

i18n.description: Ensures following best practices for i18n. Checks for missing i18n attributes on elements and attributes containing texts. Can also check for texts without i18n attribute, elements that do not use custom ID (@@) feature and duplicate custom IDs

messages.clickEventsHaveKeyEvents: click must be accompanied by either keyup, keydown or keypress event for accessibility.

click-events-have-key-events.description: Ensures that the click event is accompanied with at least one key event keyup, keydown or keypress.

messages.invalidType: "{{type}}" can not be used as a type for <button>

button-has-type.description: Ensures that a button has a valid type specified

messages.interactiveSupportsFocus: Elements with interaction handlers must be focusable.

accessibility-interactive-supports-focus.description: Ensures that elements with interactive handlers like `(click)` are focusable.

messages.accessibilityLabelFor: A label element/component must be associated with a form element

accessibility-label-for.description: Ensures that a label element/component is associated with a form element

messages.accessibilityLabelHasAssociatedControl: A label component must be associated with a form element

accessibility-label-has-associated-contr.description: Ensures that a label element/component is associated with a form element

messages.mouseEventsHaveKeyEvents: `{{mouseEvent}}` must be accompanied by `{{keyEvent}}` for accessibility (https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard)

mouse-events-have-key-events.description: Ensures that the mouse events `mouseout` and `mouseover` are accompanied by `focus` and `blur` events respectively. Coding for the keyboard is important for users with physical disabilities who cannot use a mouse, AT compatibility, and screenreader users. See more at https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard

messages.roleHasRequiredAria: The {{element}} with role="{{role}}" does not have required ARIA properties: {{missingProps}}

accessibility-role-has-required-aria.description: Ensures elements with ARIA roles have all required properties for that role.

messages.accessibilityTableScope: The `scope` attribute should only be on the `<th>` element

accessibility-table-scope.description: Ensures that the `scope` attribute is only used on the `<th>` element

messages.accessibilityValidAria: The `{{attribute}}` is an invalid ARIA attribute
messages.accessibilityValidAriaValue: The `{{attribute}}` has an invalid value. Check the valid values at https://raw.githack.com/w3c/aria/stable/#roles

accessibility-valid-aria.description: Ensures that correct ARIA attributes and respective values are used

banana-in-box.description: Ensures that the two-way data binding syntax is correct

no-any.description: The use of "$any" nullifies the compile-time benefits of Angular's type system

messages.noAutofocus: The `autofocus` attribute should not be used, as it reduces usability and accessibility for users

no-autofocus.description: Ensures that the `autofocus` attribute is not used

messages.noDistractingElements: Do not use <{{element}}> elements as they can create visual accessibility issues and are deprecated

no-distracting-elements.description: Enforces that no distracting elements are used

messages.unexpectedOtherBlock: Unexpected block statement surrounding arrow body.
messages.unexpectedEmptyBlock: Unexpected block statement surrounding arrow body; put a value of `undefined` immediately after the `=>`.
messages.unexpectedObjectBlock: Unexpected block statement surrounding arrow body; parenthesize the returned value and move it immediately after the `=>`.
messages.unexpectedSingleBlock: Unexpected block statement surrounding arrow body; move the returned value immediately after the `=>`.
messages.expectedBlock: Expected block statement surrounding arrow body.

arrow-body-style.description: require braces around arrow function bodies

prefer-arrow-callback.description: require using arrow functions for callbacks

curly.description: enforce consistent brace style for all control statements

messages.max: This line has a length of {{lineLength}}. Maximum allowed is {{maxLength}}.
messages.maxComment: This line has a comment length of {{lineLength}}. Maximum allowed is {{maxCommentLength}}.

messages.confusing: Arrow function used ambiguously with a conditional expression.

no-confusing-arrow.description: disallow arrow functions where they could be confused with comparisons

messages.unexpectedMixedOperator: Unexpected mix of '{{leftOperator}}' and '{{rightOperator}}'. Use parentheses to clarify the intended order of operations.

messages.function: Unexpected newline between function and ( of function call.
messages.property: Unexpected newline between object and [ of property access.
messages.taggedTemplate: Unexpected newline between template tag and template literal.
messages.division: Unexpected newline between numerator and division operator.

quotes.description: enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

messages.unexpectedOpeningLinebreak: There should be no linebreak after '['.
messages.unexpectedClosingLinebreak: There should be no linebreak before ']'.

array-bracket-newline.description: enforce linebreaks after opening and before closing array brackets

messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{tokenValue}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{tokenValue}}'.

array-bracket-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing inside array brackets

messages.unexpectedLineBreak: There should be no linebreak here.
messages.missingLineBreak: There should be a linebreak after this element.

array-element-newline.description: enforce line breaks after each array element

messages.unexpectedParens: Unexpected parentheses around single function argument.
messages.expectedParens: Expected parentheses around arrow function argument.
messages.unexpectedParensInline: Unexpected parentheses around single function argument having a body with no curly braces.
messages.expectedParensBlock: Expected parentheses around arrow function argument having a body with curly braces.

arrow-parens.description: require parentheses around arrow function arguments

arrow-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing before and after the arrow in arrow functions

block-spacing.description: disallow or enforce spaces inside of blocks after opening block and before closing block

messages.nextLineOpen: Opening curly brace does not appear on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.sameLineOpen: Opening curly brace appears on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.blockSameLine: Statement inside of curly braces should be on next line.
messages.nextLineClose: Closing curly brace does not appear on the same line as the subsequent block.
messages.singleLineClose: Closing curly brace should be on the same line as opening curly brace or on the line after the previous block.
messages.sameLineClose: Closing curly brace appears on the same line as the subsequent block.

brace-style.description: enforce consistent brace style for blocks

comma-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing before and after commas

messages.unexpectedLineBeforeAndAfterComma: Bad line breaking before and after ','.

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{tokenValue}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{tokenValue}}'.

computed-property-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing inside computed property brackets

messages.expectedDotAfterObject: Expected dot to be on same line as object.
messages.expectedDotBeforeProperty: Expected dot to be on same line as property.

dot-location.description: enforce consistent newlines before and after dots

messages.missing: Newline required at end of file but not found.
messages.unexpected: Newline not allowed at end of file.

eol-last.description: require or disallow newline at the end of files

messages.unexpectedWhitespace: Unexpected whitespace between function name and paren.
messages.unexpectedNewline: Unexpected newline between function name and paren.
messages.missing: Missing space between function name and paren.

func-call-spacing.description: require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

messages.unexpectedLineBreak: There should be no line break here.
messages.missingLineBreak: There should be a line break after this argument.

function-call-argument-newline.description: enforce line breaks between arguments of a function call

function-paren-newline.description: enforce consistent line breaks inside function parentheses

generator-star-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing around `*` operators in generator functions

messages.expected: Expected a linebreak before this expression.
messages.unexpected: Expected no linebreak before this expression.

implicit-arrow-linebreak.description: enforce the location of arrow function bodies

jsx-quotes.description: enforce the consistent use of either double or single quotes in JSX attributes

key-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing between keys and values in object literal properties

keyword-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

messages.expectedLF: Expected linebreaks to be 'LF' but found 'CRLF'.
messages.expectedCRLF: Expected linebreaks to be 'CRLF' but found 'LF'.

messages.expectedTestCons: Expected newline between test and consequent of ternary expression.
messages.expectedConsAlt: Expected newline between consequent and alternate of ternary expression.
messages.unexpectedTestCons: Unexpected newline between test and consequent of ternary expression.
messages.unexpectedConsAlt: Unexpected newline between consequent and alternate of ternary expression.

multiline-ternary.description: enforce newlines between operands of ternary expressions

newline-per-chained-call.description: require a newline after each call in a method chain

messages.unnecessary: Unnecessary '()' invoking a constructor with no arguments.

new-parens.description: enforce or disallow parentheses when invoking a constructor with no arguments

messages.leading: A leading decimal point can be confused with a dot.
messages.trailing: A trailing decimal point can be confused with a dot.

no-floating-decimal.description: disallow leading or trailing decimal points in numeric literals

no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs.description: disallow mixed spaces and tabs for indentation

messages.blankBeginningOfFile: Too many blank lines at the beginning of file. Max of {{max}} allowed.
messages.blankEndOfFile: Too many blank lines at the end of file. Max of {{max}} allowed.

no-trailing-spaces.description: disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines

messages.expectNoLinebreak: Expected no linebreak before this statement.
messages.expectLinebreak: Expected a linebreak before this statement.

nonblock-statement-body-position.description: enforce the location of single-line statements

messages.unexpectedLinebreakBeforeClosingBrace: Unexpected line break before this closing brace.
messages.unexpectedLinebreakAfterOpeningBrace: Unexpected line break after this opening brace.
messages.expectedLinebreakBeforeClosingBrace: Expected a line break before this closing brace.
messages.expectedLinebreakAfterOpeningBrace: Expected a line break after this opening brace.

object-curly-newline.description: enforce consistent line breaks after opening and before closing braces

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{token}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'.

messages.propertiesOnNewlineAll: Object properties must go on a new line if they aren't all on the same line.
messages.propertiesOnNewline: Object properties must go on a new line.

object-property-newline.description: enforce placing object properties on separate lines

messages.expectVarOnNewline: Expected variable declaration to be on a new line.

one-var-declaration-per-line.description: require or disallow newlines around variable declarations

messages.operatorAtBeginning: '{{operator}}' should be placed at the beginning of the line.
messages.operatorAtEnd: '{{operator}}' should be placed at the end of the line.
messages.badLinebreak: Bad line breaking before and after '{{operator}}'.
messages.noLinebreak: There should be no line break before or after '{{operator}}'.

operator-linebreak.description: enforce consistent linebreak style for operators

messages.alwaysPadBlock: Block must be padded by blank lines.
messages.neverPadBlock: Block must not be padded by blank lines.

padded-blocks.description: require or disallow padding within blocks

messages.requireQuotesDueToReservedWord: Properties should be quoted as '{{property}}' is a reserved word.
messages.unquotedReservedProperty: Unquoted reserved word '{{property}}' used as key.
messages.unquotedNumericProperty: Unquoted number literal '{{property}}' used as key.
messages.redundantQuoting: Properties shouldn't be quoted as all quotes are redundant.

quote-props.description: require quotes around object literal property names

rest-spread-spacing.description: enforce spacing between rest and spread operators and their expressions

semi.description: require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

semi-spacing.description: enforce consistent spacing before and after semicolons

messages.expectedSemiColon: Expected this semicolon to be at {{pos}}.

space-before-function-paren.description: enforce consistent spacing before `function` definition opening parenthesis

messages.missingOpeningSpace: There must be a space after this paren.
messages.missingClosingSpace: There must be a space before this paren.
messages.rejectedOpeningSpace: There should be no space after this paren.
messages.rejectedClosingSpace: There should be no space before this paren.

messages.unexpectedAfterWord: Unexpected space after unary word operator '{{word}}'.
messages.wordOperator: Unary word operator '{{word}}' must be followed by whitespace.
messages.operator: Unary operator '{{operator}}' must be followed by whitespace.
messages.beforeUnaryExpressions: Space is required before unary expressions '{{token}}'.

space-unary-ops.description: enforce consistent spacing before or after unary operators

switch-colon-spacing.description: enforce spacing around colons of switch statements

template-curly-spacing.description: require or disallow spacing around embedded expressions of template strings

messages.unexpected: Unexpected space between template tag and template literal.
messages.missing: Missing space between template tag and template literal.

template-tag-spacing.description: require or disallow spacing between template tags and their literals

unicode-bom.description: require or disallow Unicode byte order mark (BOM)

messages.wrapInvocation: Wrap an immediate function invocation in parentheses.
messages.wrapExpression: Wrap only the function expression in parens.
messages.moveInvocation: Move the invocation into the parens that contain the function.

messages.requireParens: Wrap the regexp literal in parens to disambiguate the slash.

yield-star-spacing.description: require or disallow spacing around the `*` in `yield*` expressions

messages.noSpacedFunction: Unexpected space between function name and paren.

no-spaced-func.description: disallow spacing between function identifiers and their applications (deprecated)

messages.expected: Expected literal to be on the {{expectedSide}} side of {{operator}}.

messages.missingThis: Expected 'this' to be used by class {{name}}.

messages.notMatch: Identifier '{{name}}' does not match the pattern '{{pattern}}'.

id-match.description: require identifiers to match a specified regular expression

messages.exceed: File has too many lines ({{actual}}). Maximum allowed is {{max}}.

max-lines.description: enforce a maximum number of lines per file

messages.redundantUseOfAwait: Redundant use of `await` on a return value.

messages.unexpectedSparseArray: Unexpected comma in middle of array.

no-template-curly-in-string.description: disallow template literal placeholder syntax in regular strings

messages.unexpectedBlankLine: Unexpected blank line before this statement.
messages.expectedBlankLine: Expected blank line before this statement.

padding-line-between-statements.description: require or disallow padding lines between statements

messages.useSpreadMessage: Use an object spread instead of `Object.assign` eg: `{ ...foo }`.
messages.useLiteralMessage: Use an object literal instead of `Object.assign`. eg: `{ foo: bar }`.

prefer-object-spread.description: disallow using Object.assign with an object literal as the first argument and prefer the use of object spread instead.

prefer-template.description: require template literals instead of string concatenation

messages.unexpectedVar: Unexpected var, use let or const instead.

prefer-const.description: require `const` declarations for variables that are never reassigned after declared

messages.preferSpread: Use the spread operator instead of '.apply()'.

messages.replaced: Assignment (=) can be replaced with operator assignment ({{operator}}=).

operator-assignment.description: require or disallow assignment operator shorthand where possible

messages.useDot: [{{key}}] is better written in dot notation.

messages.object: Expected an error object to be thrown.

messages.assignmentToFunctionParamProp: Assignment to property of function parameter '{{name}}'.

prefer-destructuring.description: require destructuring from arrays and/or objects

messages.noShadow: '{{name}}' is already declared in the upper scope on line {{shadowedLine}} column {{shadowedColumn}}.

no-shadow.description: disallow variable declarations from shadowing variables declared in the outer scope

no-invalid-this.description: disallow `this` keywords outside of classes or class-like objects

messages.redeclaredAsBuiltin: '{{id}}' is already defined as a built-in global variable.
messages.redeclaredBySyntax: '{{id}}' is already defined by a variable declaration.

messages.preferLiteral: The array literal notation [] is preferable.

messages.missingSome: Lacked a call of 'super()' in some code paths.
messages.badSuper: Unexpected 'super()' because 'super' is not a constructor.

messages.expected: Expected to return a value in {{name}}.
messages.expectedAlways: Expected {{name}} to always return a value.

no-dupe-keys.description: disallow duplicate keys in object literals

messages.noNewSymbol: `Symbol` cannot be called as a constructor.

messages.unexpectedRefCall: '{{name}}' is reference to '{{ref}}', which is not a function.

no-obj-calls.description: disallow calling global object properties as functions

no-undef.description: disallow the use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in `/*global */` comments

no-unreachable.description: disallow unreachable code after `return`, `throw`, `continue`, and `break` statements

messages.unexpected: Unexpected negating the left operand of '{{operator}}' operator.
messages.suggestNegatedExpression: Negate '{{operator}}' expression instead of its left operand. This changes the current behavior.
messages.suggestParenthesisedNegation: Wrap negation in '()' to make the intention explicit. This preserves the current behavior.

no-unsafe-negation.description: disallow negating the left operand of relational operators

messages.preferRestParams: Use the rest parameters instead of 'arguments'.

messages.notString: Typeof comparisons should be to string literals.

valid-typeof.description: enforce comparing `typeof` expressions against valid strings

messages.notCamelCase: Identifier '{{name}}' is not in camel case.

default-param-last.description: enforce default parameters to be last

messages.never: Unexpected blank line between class members.
messages.always: Expected blank line between class members.

lines-between-class-members.description: require or disallow an empty line between class members

messages.impliedEval: Implied eval. Consider passing a function instead of a string.

messages.noLossOfPrecision: This number literal will lose precision at runtime.

no-loss-of-precision.description: disallow literal numbers that lose precision

messages.unsafeRefs: Function declared in a loop contains unsafe references to variable(s) {{ varNames }}.

no-loop-func.description: disallow function declarations that contain unsafe references inside loop statements

messages.unusedExpression: Expected an assignment or function call and instead saw an expression.

messages.usedBeforeDefined: '{{name}}' was used before it was defined.

no-use-before-define.description: disallow the use of variables before they are defined

require-await.description: disallow async functions which have no `await` expression

messages.sortKeys: Expected object keys to be in {{natural}}{{insensitive}}{{order}}ending order. '{{thisName}}' should be before '{{prevName}}'.

sort-keys.description: require object keys to be sorted

messages.complex: {{name}} has a complexity of {{complexity}}. Maximum allowed is {{max}}.

complexity.description: enforce a maximum cyclomatic complexity allowed in a program

messages.wrap: The body of a for-in should be wrapped in an if statement to filter unwanted properties from the prototype.

guard-for-in.description: require `for-in` loops to include an `if` statement

messages.maximumExceeded: File has too many classes ({{ classCount }}). Maximum allowed is {{ max }}.

max-classes-per-file.description: enforce a maximum number of classes per file

messages.missing: Expected a conditional expression and instead saw an assignment.

no-cond-assign.description: disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

messages.noConstructor: Do not use {{fn}} as a constructor.

no-new-wrappers.description: disallow `new` operators with the `String`, `Number`, and `Boolean` objects

messages.path: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used.
messages.pathWithCustomMessage: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used. {{customMessage}}
messages.patterns: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used by a pattern.
messages.patternWithCustomMessage: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used by a pattern. {{customMessage}}
messages.everything: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted.
messages.everythingWithCustomMessage: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted. {{customMessage}}

no-restricted-imports.description: disallow specified modules when loaded by `import`

messages.unnecessaryUndefinedInit: It's not necessary to initialize '{{name}}' to undefined.

no-unsafe-finally.description: disallow control flow statements in `finally` blocks

messages.expectedLiteralMethodLongform: Expected longform method syntax for string literal keys.
messages.unexpectedMix: Unexpected mix of shorthand and non-shorthand properties.

object-shorthand.description: require or disallow method and property shorthand syntax for object literals

messages.combineUninitialized: Combine this with the previous '{{type}}' statement with uninitialized variables.
messages.combineInitialized: Combine this with the previous '{{type}}' statement with initialized variables.
messages.splitUninitialized: Split uninitialized '{{type}}' declarations into multiple statements.
messages.splitInitialized: Split initialized '{{type}}' declarations into multiple statements.
messages.splitRequires: Split requires to be separated into a single block.
messages.combine: Combine this with the previous '{{type}}' statement.

one-var.description: enforce variables to be declared either together or separately in functions

messages.invalidRadix: Invalid radix parameter, must be an integer between 2 and 36.
messages.addRadixParameter10: Add radix parameter `10` for parsing decimal numbers.

radix.description: enforce the consistent use of the radix argument when using `parseInt()`

messages.comparisonWithNaN: Use the isNaN function to compare with NaN.
messages.switchNaN: 'switch(NaN)' can never match a case clause. Use Number.isNaN instead of the switch.
messages.caseNaN: 'case NaN' can never match. Use Number.isNaN before the switch.
messages.indexOfNaN: Array prototype method '{{ methodName }}' cannot find NaN.

use-isnan.description: require calls to `isNaN()` when checking for `NaN`

quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

messages.nextLineOpen: Opening curly brace does not appear on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.sameLineOpen: Opening curly brace appears on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.blockSameLine: Statement inside of curly braces should be on next line.
messages.nextLineClose: Closing curly brace does not appear on the same line as the subsequent block.
messages.singleLineClose: Closing curly brace should be on the same line as opening curly brace or on the line after the previous block.
messages.sameLineClose: Closing curly brace appears on the same line as the subsequent block.

brace-style.description: Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

comma-spacing.description: Enforces consistent spacing before and after commas

messages.unexpectedWhitespace: Unexpected whitespace between function name and paren.
messages.unexpectedNewline: Unexpected newline between function name and paren.
messages.missing: Missing space between function name and paren.

func-call-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

keyword-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

member-delimiter-style.description: Require a specific member delimiter style for interfaces and type literals

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{token}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'.

semi.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

space-before-function-paren.description: Enforces consistent spacing before function parenthesis

space-infix-ops.description: This rule is aimed at ensuring there are spaces around infix operators.

messages.unexpectedSpaceBetween: Unexpected space between the '{{previousToken}}' and the '{{type}}'.

type-annotation-spacing.description: Require consistent spacing around type annotations

messages.unexpectedUnderscore: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must not have a {{position}} underscore.
messages.missingAffix: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must have one of the following {{position}}es: {{affixes}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormat: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormatTrimmed: {{type}} name `{{name}}` trimmed as `{{processedName}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}

naming-convention.description: Enforces naming conventions for everything across a codebase

messages.unbound: Avoid referencing unbound methods which may cause unintentional scoping of `this`.
messages.unboundWithoutThisAnnotation:
Avoid referencing unbound methods which may cause unintentional scoping of `this`.
If your function does not access `this`, you can annotate it with `this: void`, or consider using an arrow function instead.

unbound-method.description: Enforces unbound methods are called with their expected scope

messages.incorrectOrder: Member "{{member}}" should be declared before member "{{beforeMember}}".
messages.incorrectGroupOrder: Member {{name}} should be declared before all {{rank}} definitions.

member-ordering.description: Require a consistent member declaration order

ban-types.description: Bans specific types from being used

Object.message: Avoid using the `Object` type. Did you mean `object`?

Function.message: Avoid using the `Function` type. Prefer a specific function type, like `() => void`.

Boolean.message: Avoid using the `Boolean` type. Did you mean `boolean`?

Number.message: Avoid using the `Number` type. Did you mean `number`?

String.message: Avoid using the `String` type. Did you mean `string`?

Symbol.message: Avoid using the `Symbol` type. Did you mean `symbol`?

prefer-string-starts-ends-with.description: Enforce the use of `String#startsWith` and `String#endsWith` instead of other equivalent methods of checking substrings

messages.anyTypedArg: Argument '{{name}}' should be typed with a non-any type.
messages.anyTypedArgUnnamed: {{type}} argument should be typed with a non-any type.

explicit-module-boundary-types.description: Require explicit return and argument types on exported functions' and classes' public class methods

messages.preferOptionalChain: Prefer using an optional chain expression instead, as it's more concise and easier to read.

prefer-optional-chain.description: Prefer using concise optional chain expressions instead of chained logical ands

messages.unexpectedAny: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.
messages.suggestUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
messages.suggestNever: Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

messages.preferStringIncludes: Use `String#includes()` method with a string instead.

messages.invalidVoidForGeneric: {{ generic }} may not have void as a type variable.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type variable.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturn: void is only valid as a return type.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParam: void is only valid as return type or type of `this` parameter.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParamOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type variable or the type of a `this` parameter.

no-invalid-void-type.description: Disallows usage of `void` type outside of generic or return types

messages.object: Expected an error object to be thrown.

messages.noInferrableType: Type {{type}} trivially inferred from a {{type}} literal, remove type annotation.

no-inferrable-types.description: Disallows explicit type declarations for variables or parameters initialized to a number, string, or boolean

messages.noUseBeforeDefine: '{{name}}' was used before it was defined.

no-use-before-define.description: Disallow the use of variables before they are defined

default-param-last.description: Enforce default parameters to be last

messages.redeclaredAsBuiltin: '{{id}}' is already defined as a built-in global variable.
messages.redeclaredBySyntax: '{{id}}' is already defined by a variable declaration.

messages.never: Unexpected blank line between class members.
messages.always: Expected blank line between class members.

lines-between-class-members.description: Require or disallow an empty line between class members

messages.noEmpty: An empty interface is equivalent to `{}`.
messages.noEmptyWithSuper: An interface declaring no members is equivalent to its supertype.

no-empty-interface.description: Disallow the declaration of empty interfaces

no-base-to-string.description: Requires that `.toString()` is only called on objects which provide useful information when stringified

messages.unusedExpression: Expected an assignment or function call and instead saw an expression.

messages.noShadow: '{{name}}' is already declared in the upper scope.

no-shadow.description: Disallow variable declarations from shadowing variables declared in the outer scope

explicit-member-accessibility.description: Require explicit accessibility modifiers on class properties and methods

messages.missingAsync: Functions that return promises must be async.

promise-function-async.description: Requires any function or method that returns a Promise to be marked async

consistent-type-definitions.description: Consistent with type definition either `interface` or `type`

messages.useDot: [{{key}}] is better written in dot notation.

messages.never: Do not use any type assertions.

consistent-type-assertions.description: Enforces consistent usage of type assertions

messages.notNumbers: Operands of '+' operation must either be both strings or both numbers.
messages.notStrings: Operands of '+' operation must either be both strings or both numbers. Consider using a template literal.
messages.notBigInts: Operands of '+' operation must be both bigints.

restrict-plus-operands.description: When adding two variables, operands must both be of type number or of type string

messages.preferForOf: Expected a `for-of` loop instead of a `for` loop with this simple iteration.

prefer-for-of.description: Prefer a for-of loop over a standard for loop if the index is only used to access the array being iterated

messages.defineInitializer: The value of the member '{{ name }}' should be explicitly defined.
messages.defineInitializerSuggestion: Can be fixed to {{ name }} = {{ suggested }}

prefer-enum-initializers.description: Prefer initializing each enums member value

explicit-function-return-type.description: Require explicit return types on functions and class methods

messages.voidReturn: Promise returned in function argument where a void return was expected.
messages.conditional: Expected non-Promise value in a boolean conditional.

no-misused-promises.description: Avoid using promises in places not designed to handle them

messages.suggestExplicitUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.

no-implicit-any-catch.description: Disallow usage of the implicit `any` type in catch clauses

ban-tslint-comment.description: Bans `// tslint:<rule-flag>` comments from being used

messages.preferFieldStyle: Literals should be exposed using readonly fields.
messages.preferGetterStyle: Literals should be exposed using getters.

class-literal-property-style.description: Ensures that literals on classes are exposed in a consistent style

messages.confusingEqual: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! == b", which looks very similar to not equal "a !== b".
messages.confusingAssign: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! = b", which looks very similar to not equal "a != b".
messages.notNeedInEqualTest: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in equal test.
messages.notNeedInAssign: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in assignment left hand.
messages.wrapUpLeft: Wrap up left hand to avoid putting non-null assertion "!" and "=" together.

no-confusing-non-null-assertion.description: Disallow non-null assertion in locations that may be confusing

messages.onlyStatic: Unexpected class with only static properties.
messages.onlyConstructor: Unexpected class with only a constructor.

no-extraneous-class.description: Forbids the use of classes as namespaces

messages.direct: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of using it directly.
messages.negated: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueDirect: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of using it directly.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueNegated: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToFalse: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to false instead of using the ?? operator to provide a default.

no-unnecessary-boolean-literal-compare.description: Flags unnecessary equality comparisons against boolean literals

messages.functionTypeOverCallableType: {{ literalOrInterface }} only has a call signature, you should use a function type instead.
messages.unexpectedThisOnFunctionOnlyInterface: `this` refers to the function type '{{ interfaceName }}', did you intend to use a generic `this` parameter like `<Self>(this: Self, ...) => Self` instead?

prefer-function-type.description: Use function types instead of interfaces with call signatures

messages.notLiteral: Explicit enum value must only be a literal value (string, number, boolean, etc).

prefer-literal-enum-member.description: Require that all enum members be literal values to prevent unintended enum member name shadow issues

messages.preferTypeParameter: Unnecessary cast: Array#reduce accepts a type parameter for the default value.

prefer-reduce-type-parameter.description: Prefer using type parameter when calling `Array#reduce` instead of casting

messages.preferExpectErrorComment: Use "@ts-expect-error" to ensure an error is actually being suppressed.

unified-signatures.description: Warns for any two overloads that could be unified into one by using a union or an optional/rest parameter

messages.preferNullish: Prefer using nullish coalescing operator (`??`) instead of a logical or (`||`), as it is a safer operator.

prefer-nullish-coalescing.description: Enforce the usage of the nullish coalescing operator instead of logical chaining

messages.alwaysTruthy: Unnecessary conditional, value is always truthy.
messages.alwaysFalsy: Unnecessary conditional, value is always falsy.
messages.alwaysTruthyFunc: This callback should return a conditional, but return is always truthy.
messages.alwaysFalsyFunc: This callback should return a conditional, but return is always falsy.
messages.neverNullish: Unnecessary conditional, expected left-hand side of `??` operator to be possibly null or undefined.
messages.alwaysNullish: Unnecessary conditional, left-hand side of `??` operator is always `null` or `undefined`.
messages.literalBooleanExpression: Unnecessary conditional, both sides of the expression are literal values.
messages.noOverlapBooleanExpression: Unnecessary conditional, the types have no overlap.
messages.neverOptionalChain: Unnecessary optional chain on a non-nullish value.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.

no-unnecessary-condition.description: Prevents conditionals where the type is always truthy or always falsy

messages.floatingVoid: Promises must be handled appropriately or explicitly marked as ignored with the `void` operator.

no-floating-promises.description: Requires Promise-like values to be handled appropriately

messages.conditionErrorOther: Unexpected value in conditional. A boolean expression is required.
messages.conditionErrorAny: Unexpected any value in conditional. An explicit comparison or type cast is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullish: Unexpected nullish value in conditional. The condition is always false.
messages.conditionErrorNullableBoolean: Unexpected nullable boolean value in conditional. Please handle the nullish case explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorString: Unexpected string value in conditional. An explicit empty string check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableString: Unexpected nullable string value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/empty cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorNumber: Unexpected number value in conditional. An explicit zero/NaN check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableNumber: Unexpected nullable number value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/zero/NaN cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorObject: Unexpected object value in conditional. The condition is always true.
messages.conditionErrorNullableObject: Unexpected nullable object value in conditional. An explicit null check is required.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.
messages.conditionFixDefaultFalse: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as false (`value ?? false`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultEmptyString: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as an empty string (`value ?? ""`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultZero: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as 0 (`value ?? 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNullish: Change condition to check for null/undefined (`value != null`)
messages.conditionFixCastBoolean: Explicitly cast value to a boolean (`Boolean(value)`)
messages.conditionFixCompareTrue: Change condition to check if true (`value === true`)
messages.conditionFixCompareFalse: Change condition to check if false (`value === false`)
messages.conditionFixCompareStringLength: Change condition to check string's length (`value.length !== 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareEmptyString: Change condition to check for empty string (`value !== ""`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNaN: Change condition to check for NaN (`!Number.isNaN(value)`)

strict-boolean-expressions.description: Restricts the types allowed in boolean expressions

messages.dynamicDelete: Do not delete dynamically computed property keys.

no-dynamic-delete.description: Disallow the delete operator with computed key expressions

await-thenable.description: Disallows awaiting a value that is not a Thenable

messages.tsDirectiveComment: Do not use "@ts-{{directive}}" because it alters compilation errors.
messages.tsDirectiveCommentRequiresDescription: Include a description after the "@ts-{{directive}}" directive to explain why the @ts-{{directive}} is necessary. The description must be {{minimumDescriptionLength}} characters or longer.

ban-ts-comment.description: Bans `@ts-<directive>` comments from being used or requires descriptions after directive

messages.forInViolation: For-in loops over arrays are forbidden. Use for-of or array.forEach instead.

no-for-in-array.description: Disallow iterating over an array with a for-in loop

messages.thisAssignment: Unexpected aliasing of 'this' to local variable.
messages.thisDestructure: Unexpected aliasing of members of 'this' to local variables.

messages.unnecessaryTypeParameter: This is the default value for this type parameter, so it can be omitted.

no-unnecessary-type-arguments.description: Enforces that type arguments will not be used if not required

messages.unnecessaryAssertion: This assertion is unnecessary since it does not change the type of the expression.
messages.contextuallyUnnecessary: This assertion is unnecessary since the receiver accepts the original type of the expression.

no-unnecessary-type-assertion.description: Warns if a type assertion does not change the type of an expression

require-await.description: Disallow async functions which have no `await` expression

messages.tripleSlashReference: Do not use a triple slash reference for {{module}}, use `import` style instead.

triple-slash-reference.description: Sets preference level for triple slash directives versus ES6-style import declarations

no-invalid-this.description: Disallow `this` keywords outside of classes or class-like objects

messages.preferReadonly: Member '{{name}}' is never reassigned; mark it as `readonly`.

prefer-readonly.description: Requires that private members are marked as `readonly` if they're never modified outside of the constructor

messages.errorStringGeneric: Array type using '{{type}}[]' is forbidden. Use 'Array<{{type}}>' instead.
messages.errorStringGenericSimple: Array type using '{{type}}[]' is forbidden for non-simple types. Use 'Array<{{type}}>' instead.
messages.errorStringArray: Array type using 'Array<{{type}}>' is forbidden. Use '{{type}}[]' instead.
messages.errorStringArraySimple: Array type using 'Array<{{type}}>' is forbidden for simple types. Use '{{type}}[]' instead.

array-type.description: Requires using either `T[]` or `Array<T>` for arrays

adjacent-overload-signatures.description: Require that member overloads be consecutive

messages.useLiteral: The array literal notation [] is preferable.

messages.errorMessageInterface: Interfaces cannot be constructed, only classes.

messages.moduleSyntaxIsPreferred: ES2015 module syntax is preferred over custom TypeScript modules and namespaces.

no-namespace.description: Disallow the use of custom TypeScript modules and namespaces

messages.noNonNullOptionalChain: Optional chain expressions can return undefined by design - using a non-null assertion is unsafe and wrong.
messages.suggestRemovingNonNull: You should remove the non-null assertion.

no-non-null-asserted-optional-chain.description: Disallows using a non-null assertion after an optional chain expression

messages.suggestOptionalChain: Consider using the optional chain operator `?.` instead. This operator includes runtime checks, so it is safer than the compile-only non-null assertion operator.

no-non-null-assertion.description: Disallows non-null assertions using the `!` postfix operator

messages.noVarReqs: Require statement not part of import statement.

no-var-requires.description: Disallows the use of require statements except in import statements

messages.preferConstAssertion: Expected a `const` instead of a literal type assertion.
messages.variableConstAssertion: Expected a `const` assertion instead of a literal type annotation.
messages.variableSuggest: You should use `as const` instead of type annotation.

prefer-as-const.description: Prefer usage of `as const` over literal type

messages.useNamespace: Use 'namespace' instead of 'module' to declare custom TypeScript modules.

prefer-namespace-keyword.description: Require the use of the `namespace` keyword instead of the `module` keyword to declare custom TypeScript modules

messages.noImpliedEvalError: Implied eval. Consider passing a function.
messages.noFunctionConstructor: Implied eval. Do not use the Function constructor to create functions.

messages.noLossOfPrecision: This number literal will lose precision at runtime.

no-loss-of-precision.description: Disallow literal numbers that lose precision

messages.unsafeRefs: Function declared in a loop contains unsafe references to variable(s) {{ varNames }}.

no-loop-func.description: Disallow function declarations that contain unsafe references inside loop statements

messages.nonPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited value that is not a promise is not allowed.
messages.disallowedPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited promise is not allowed in this context.
messages.requiredPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited promise is required in this context.

return-await.description: Enforces consistent returning of awaited values

messages.noParamProp: Property {{parameter}} cannot be declared in the constructor.

no-parameter-properties.description: Disallow the use of parameter properties in class constructors

messages.empty-brace-spaces: Do not add spaces between braces.

messages.should-parenthesized: Nest ternary expression should be parenthesized.

number-literal-case.description: Enforce proper case for numeric literals.

better-regex.description: Improve regexes by making them shorter, consistent, and safer.

messages.catch-error-name: The catch parameter `{{originalName}}` should be named `{{fixedName}}`.

catch-error-name.description: Enforce a specific parameter name in catch clauses.

consistent-function-scoping.description: Move function definitions to the highest possible scope.

messages.invalidExport: Exported error name should match error class

messages.missing-message: Pass a message to the `{{constructorName}}` constructor.
messages.message-is-empty-string: Error message should not be an empty string.
messages.message-is-not-a-string: Error message should be a string.

error-message.description: Enforce passing a `message` value when creating a built-in error.

messages.escape-case: Use uppercase characters for the value of the escape sequence.

escape-case.description: Require escape sequences to use uppercase values.

messages.unicorn/avoidMultipleDates: Avoid using multiple expiration dates in TODO: {{expirationDates}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/expiredTodo: There is a TODO that is past due date: {{expirationDate}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/reachedPackageVersion: There is a TODO that is past due package version: {{comparison}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/avoidMultiplePackageVersions: Avoid using multiple package versions in TODO: {{versions}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/havePackage: There is a TODO that is deprecated since you installed: {{package}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/dontHavePackage: There is a TODO that is deprecated since you uninstalled: {{package}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/versionMatches: There is a TODO match for package version: {{comparison}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/engineMatches: There is a TODO match for Node.js version: {{comparison}}. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/removeWhitespaces: Avoid using whitespace on TODO argument. On '{{original}}' use '{{fix}}'. {{message}}
messages.unicorn/missingAtSymbol: Missing '@' on TODO argument. On '{{original}}' use '{{fix}}'. {{message}}

expiring-todo-comments.description: Add expiration conditions to TODO comments.

messages.non-zero: Use `.{{property}} {{code}}` when checking {{property}} is not zero.

explicit-length-check.description: Enforce explicitly comparing the `length` or `size` property of a value.

messages.filename-case: Filename is not in {{chosenCases}}. Rename it to {{renamedFilenames}}.
messages.filename-extension: File extension `{{extension}}` is not in lowercase. Rename it to `{{filename}}`.

filename-case.description: Enforce a case style for filenames.

messages.import-index: Do not reference the index file directly..

import-style.description: Enforce specific import styles per module.

new-for-builtins.description: Enforce the use of `new` for all builtins, except `String`, `Number`, `Boolean`, `Symbol` and `BigInt`.

messages.no-abusive-eslint-disable: Specify the rules you want to disable.

no-abusive-eslint-disable.description: Enforce specifying rules to disable in `eslint-disable` comments.

messages.error-with-name: Do not pass function `{{name}}` directly to `.{{method}}()`.
messages.error-without-name: Do not pass function directly to `.{{method}}()`.

no-array-callback-reference.description: Prevent passing a function reference directly to iterator methods.

messages.error: Do not use the `this` argument in `Array#{{method}}()`.

no-array-method-this-argument.description: Disallow using the `this` argument in array methods.

no-array-push-push.description: Enforce combining multiple `Array#push()` into one call.

messages.no-await-expression-member: Do not access a member directly from an await expression.

no-await-expression-member.description: Forbid member access from await expression.

messages.no-console-spaces: Do not use {{position}} space between `console.{{method}}` parameters.

no-console-spaces.description: Do not use leading/trailing space between `console.log` parameters.

messages.no-for-loop: Use a `for-of` loop instead of this `for` loop.

no-for-loop.description: Do not use a `for` loop that can be replaced with a `for-of` loop.

messages.no-hex-escape: Use Unicode escapes instead of hexadecimal escapes.

no-hex-escape.description: Enforce the use of Unicode escapes instead of hexadecimal escapes.

messages.no-invalid-remove-event-listener: The listener argument should be a function reference.

no-invalid-remove-event-listener.description: Prevent calling `EventTarget#removeEventListener()` with the result of an expression.

messages.noKeywordPrefix: Do not prefix identifiers with keyword `{{keyword}}`.

messages.no-lonely-if: Unexpected `if` as the only statement in a `if` block without `else`.

no-lonely-if.description: Disallow `if` statements as the only statement in `if` blocks without `else`.

messages.array-length: The argument is the length of array.
messages.only-element: The argument is the only element of array.

messages.error-unknown: `new Buffer()` is deprecated, use `Buffer.alloc()` or `Buffer.from()` instead.

no-new-buffer.description: Enforce the use of `Buffer.from()` and `Buffer.alloc()` instead of the deprecated `new Buffer()`.

no-null.description: Disallow the use of the `null` literal.

messages.identifier: Do not use an object literal as default for parameter `{{parameter}}`.
messages.non-identifier: Do not use an object literal as default.

no-object-as-default-parameter.description: Disallow the use of objects as default parameters.

messages.no-process-exit: Only use `process.exit()` in CLI apps. Throw an error instead.

messages.no-static-only-class: Use an object instead of a class with only static members.

no-static-only-class.description: Forbid classes that only have static members.

messages.no-unreadable-array-destructuring: Array destructuring may not contain consecutive ignored values.

messages.no-unused-properties: Property `{{name}}` is defined but never used.

no-useless-fallback-in-spread.description: Forbid useless fallback when spreading in object literals.

messages.non-zero: The non-empty check is useless as `Array#some()` returns `false` for an empty array.
messages.zero: The empty check is useless as `Array#every()` returns `true` for an empty array.

messages.spread-in-list: Spread an {{argumentType}} literal in {{parentDescription}} is unnecessary.
messages.iterable-to-array: `{{parentDescription}}` accepts iterable as argument, it's unnecessary to convert to an array.
messages.iterable-to-array-in-for-of: `forof` can iterate over iterable, it's unnecessary to convert to an array.
messages.iterable-to-array-in-yield-star: `yield*` can delegate iterable, it's unnecessary to convert to an array.

messages.zero-fraction: Don't use a zero fraction in the number.
messages.dangling-dot: Don't use a dangling dot in the number.

no-zero-fractions.description: Disallow number literals with zero fractions or dangling dots.

messages.numeric-separators-style: Invalid group length in numeric value.

numeric-separators-style.description: Enforce the style of numeric separators by correctly grouping digits.

prefer-array-find.description: Prefer `.find()` over the first element from `.filter()`.

messages.prefer-array-flat: Prefer `Array#flat()` over `{{description}}` to flatten an array.

prefer-array-flat.description: Prefer `Array#flat()` over legacy techniques to flatten arrays.

messages.prefer-indexOf-over-findIndex//error: Use `.indexOf()` instead of `.findIndex()` when looking for the index of an item.

prefer-array-index-of.description: Prefer `Array#indexOf()` over `Array#findIndex()` when looking for the index of an item.

messages.filter: Prefer `.some()` over non-zero length check from `.filter()`.

messages.slice: Prefer `.at()` over the first element from `.slice()`.
messages.get-last-function: Prefer `.at(-1)` over `{{description}}()` to get the last element.

prefer-at.description: Prefer `.at()` method for index access and `String#charAt()`.

prefer-date-now.description: Prefer `Date.now()` to get the number of milliseconds since the Unix Epoch.

prefer-dom-node-dataset.description: Prefer using `.dataset` on DOM elements over `.setAttribute()`.

messages.prefer-includes: Use `.includes()`, rather than `.indexOf()`, when checking for existence.
messages.prefer-includes-over-some//error: Use `.includes()` instead of `.some()` when checking value existence.

prefer-includes.description: Prefer `.includes()` over `.indexOf()` and `Array#some()` when checking for existence or non-existence.

prefer-math-trunc.description: Enforce the use of `Math.trunc` instead of bitwise operators.

prefer-modern-dom-apis.description: Prefer `.before()` over `.insertBefore()`, `.replaceWith()` over `.replaceChild()`, prefer one of `.before()`, `.after()`, `.append()` or `.prepend()` over `insertAdjacentText()` and `insertAdjacentElement()`.

messages.error/global-return: "return" should be used inside a function.

messages.prefer-negative-index: Prefer negative index over length minus index for `{{method}}`.

prefer-negative-index.description: Prefer negative index over `.length - index` for `{String,Array,TypedArray}#slice()`, `Array#splice()` and `Array#at()`.

prefer-node-protocol.description: Prefer using the `node:` protocol when importing Node.js builtin modules.

prefer-number-properties.description: Prefer `Number` static properties over global ones.

prefer-object-from-entries.description: Prefer using `Object.fromEntries()` to transform a list of key-value pairs into an object.

prefer-prototype-methods.description: Prefer borrowing methods from the prototype instead of the instance.

messages.error: `{{name}}` should be a `Set`, and use `{{name}}.has()` to check existence or non-existence.

prefer-set-has.description: Prefer `Set#has()` over `Array#includes()` when checking for existence or non-existence.

prefer-spread.description: Prefer the spread operator over `Array.from()`, `Array#concat()`, `Array#slice()` and `String#split('')`.

prefer-string-replace-all.description: Prefer `String#replaceAll()` over regex searches with the global flag.

messages.prefer-ternary: This `if` statement can be replaced by a ternary expression.

prefer-ternary.description: Prefer ternary expressions over simple `if-else` statements.

messages.promise: Prefer top-level await over using a promise chain.
messages.iife: Prefer top-level await over an async IIFE.
messages.identifier: Prefer top-level await over an async function `{{name}}` call.

prefer-top-level-await.description: Prefer top-level await over top-level promises and async function calls.

messages.prefer-type-error: `new Error()` is too unspecific for a type check. Use `new TypeError()` instead.

prefer-type-error.description: Enforce throwing `TypeError` in type checking conditions.

messages.replace: The {{nameTypeText}} `{{discouragedName}}` should be named `{{replacement}}`. A more descriptive name will do too.
messages.suggestion: Please rename the {{nameTypeText}} `{{discouragedName}}`. Suggested names are: {{replacementsText}}. A more descriptive name will do too.

require-array-join-separator.description: Enforce using the separator argument with `Array#join()`.

require-number-to-fixed-digits-argument.description: Enforce using the digits argument with `Number#toFixed()`.

src.description: files/paths to be analyzed (only for unused exports)

ignoreExports.description: files/paths for which unused exports will not be reported (e.g module entry points)

no-self-import.description: Forbid a module from importing itself

messages.forbidden: Unsafe optional next calls are forbidden.
Passing non-Error values are forbidden.

throw-error.description: Enforces the passing of `Error` values to error notifications.

messages.shouldBeFinnish: Finnish notation should be used here.
messages.shouldNotBeFinnish: Finnish notation should not be used here.

finnish.description: Enforces the use of Finnish notation.

messages.suggestExplicitUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly and safely assert the type is correct.

no-implicit-any-catch.description: Forbids implicit `any` error parameters in `catchError` operators.

messages.forbidden: The toPromise method is forbidden.

no-topromise.description: Forbids the use of the `toPromise` method.

messages.forbidden: Redundant notifications are forbidden.

no-redundant-notify.description: Forbids redundant notifications from completed or errored observables.

messages.forbidden: Ignoring a returned Observable is forbidden.

no-ignored-observable.description: Forbids the ignoring of observables returned by functions.

messages.forbidden: Subject identifiers must end with "{{suffix}}".

suffix-subjects.description: Enforces the use of a suffix in subject identifiers.

messages.forbidden: Explicit generic type arguments are forbidden.
Subject '{{subject}}' must be private.
messages.forbiddenAllowProtected: Subject '{{subject}}' must be private or protected.

messages.forbidden: Unbound methods are forbidden.

no-unbound-methods.description: Forbids the passing of unbound methods.

messages.forbidden: Applying operators after takeUntil is forbidden.

schema.description:
An optional object with optional `alias` and `allow` properties.
The `alias` property is an array containing the names of operators that aliases for `takeUntil`.
The `allow` property is an array containing the names of the operators that are allowed to follow `takeUntil`.

no-unsafe-takeuntil.description: Forbids the application of operators after `takeUntil`.

messages.forbidden: shareReplay is forbidden.
messages.forbiddenWithoutConfig: shareReplay is forbidden unless a config argument is passed.

messages.forbidden: Nested subscribe calls are forbidden.

no-nested-subscribe.description: Forbids the calling of `subscribe` within a `subscribe` callback.

messages.forbidden: Unsafe catchError usage in effects and epics are forbidden.

schema.description:
An optional object with an optional `observable` property.
The property can be specified as a regular expression string and is used to identify the action observables from which effects and epics are composed.

no-unsafe-catch.description: Forbids unsafe `catchError` usage in effects and epics.

messages.forbidden: Passing async functions to subscribe is forbidden.
Observable.create is forbidden; use new Observable.
Ignoring the notifier is forbidden.

no-ignored-notifier.description: Forbids observables not composed from the `repeatWhen` or `retryWhen` notifier.

messages.forbidden: Ignoring the buffer size is forbidden.

no-ignored-replay-buffer.description: Forbids using `ReplaySubject`, `publishReplay` or `shareReplay` without specifying the buffer size.

messages.forbidden: Ignoring the value within takeWhile is forbidden.
RxJS imports from index modules are forbidden.

no-index.description: Forbids the importation from index modules.

messages.forbidden: RxJS imports from internal are forbidden.
Calling unsubscribe on a subject is forbidden.

no-subject-unsubscribe.description: Forbids calling the `unsubscribe` method of a subject instance.

messages.componentMaxInlineDeclarations: `{{propertyType}}` has too many lines ({{lineCount}}). Maximum allowed is {{max}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-04)

component-max-inline-declarations.description: Enforces a maximum number of lines in inline template, styles and animations. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-04

messages.noEmptyLifecycleMethod: Lifecycle methods should not be empty

allowedNames.description: A list with allowed input names

messages.noInputRename: Input bindings should not be aliased (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-13)
messages.suggestReplaceOriginalNameWithAliasName: Remove alias name and use it as the original name

no-input-rename.description: Ensures that input bindings are not aliased

messages.preferOnPushComponentChangeDetection: The component's `changeDetection` value should be set to `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush`

messages.useComponentSelector: The selector of the component is mandatory

messages.noAttributeDecorator: @Attribute can only obtain a single value and is rarely what is required. Use @Input instead to retrieve a stream of values.

no-attribute-decorator.description: The @Attribute decorator is used to obtain a single value for an attribute. This is a much less common use-case than getting a stream of values (using @Input), so often the @Attribute decorator is mistakenly used when @Input was what was intended. This rule disallows usage of @Attribute decorator altogether in order to prevent these mistakes.

no-forward-ref.description: Disallows usage of `forwardRef` references for DI

messages.noLifecycleCall: Avoid explicit calls to lifecycle methods

no-lifecycle-call.description: Disallows explicit calls to lifecycle methods

messages.noPipeImpure: Impure pipes should be avoided because they are invoked on each change-detection cycle

no-pipe-impure.description: Disallows the declaration of impure pipes

messages.noQueriesMetadataProperty: Use @Output rather than the `queries` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12)

no-queries-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `queries` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12.

messages.preferOutputReadonly: Prefer to declare `@Output` as `readonly` since they are not supposed to be reassigned

prefer-output-readonly.description: Prefer to declare `@Output` as `readonly` since they are not supposed to be reassigned

messages.useComponentViewEncapsulation: Using `ViewEncapsulation.None` makes your styles global, which may have an unintended effect

messages.componentClassSuffix: Component class names should end with one of these suffixes: {{suffixes}} (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03)

component-class-suffix.description: Classes decorated with @Component must have suffix "Component" (or custom) in their name. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03

messages.prefixFailure: The selector should start with one of these prefixes: {{prefix}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-07)
messages.typeFailure: The selector should be used as an {{type}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-03)
messages.shadowDomEncapsulatedStyleFailure: The selector of a ShadowDom-encapsulated component should be `kebab-case` (https://github.com/angular-eslint/angular-eslint/issues/534)

component-selector.description:
Component selectors should follow given naming rules. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-07, https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-02
      and https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-03.

messages.contextualLifecycle: Angular will not invoke the `{{methodName}}` lifecycle method within `@{{classDecoratorName}}()` classes

contextual-lifecycle.description: Ensures that lifecycle methods are used in a correct context

messages.directiveClassSuffix: Directive class names should end with one of these suffixes: {{suffixes}} (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03)

directive-class-suffix.description: Classes decorated with @Directive must have suffix "Directive" (or custom) in their name. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03

messages.prefixFailure: The selector should start with one of these prefixes: {{prefix}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-08)
messages.typeFailure: The selector should be used as an {{type}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-06)

directive-selector.description: Directive selectors should follow given naming rules. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-06 and https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-08.

messages.noConflictingLifecycleInterface: Implementing DoCheck and OnChanges in a class is not recommended
messages.noConflictingLifecycleMethod: Declaring ngDoCheck and ngOnChanges method in a class is not recommended

no-conflicting-lifecycle.description: Ensures that directives not implement conflicting lifecycle interfaces.

messages.noHostMetadataProperty: Use @HostBinding or @HostListener rather than the `host` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-06-03)

no-host-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `host` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-06-03

messages.noInputsMetadataProperty: Use `@Input` rather than the `inputs` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12)

no-inputs-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `inputs` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12

messages.noOutputNative: Output bindings, including aliases, should not be named as standard DOM events

no-output-native.description: Ensures that output bindings, including aliases, are not named as standard DOM events

messages.noOutputOnPrefix: Output bindings, including aliases, should not be named "on", nor prefixed with it (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-16)

no-output-on-prefix.description: Ensures that output bindings, including aliases, are not named "on", nor prefixed with it. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-16

messages.noOutputRename: Output bindings should not be aliased (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-13)
messages.suggestReplaceOriginalNameWithAliasName: Remove alias name and use it as the original name

no-output-rename.description: Ensures that output bindings are not aliased

messages.noOutputsMetadataProperty: Use `@Output` rather than the `outputs` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12)

no-outputs-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `outputs` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12

messages.useLifecycleInterface: Lifecycle interface '{{interfaceName}}' should be implemented for method '{{methodName}}'. (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-09-01)

use-lifecycle-interface.description: Ensures that classes implement lifecycle interfaces corresponding to the declared lifecycle methods. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-09-01

no-types.description: This rule reports types being used on `@param` or `@returns`.

newline-after-description.description: Enforces a consistent padding of the block description.

check-alignment.description: Reports invalid alignment of JSDoc block asterisks.

messages.sort: Run autofix to sort these exports!
Run autofix to sort these imports!

messages.expectedAbove: Expected @{{ name }} to be on the line above.

decorator-position.description: enforce consistent decorator position on properties and methods
